intro: Utricularia chamissonis, commonly known as the floating bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that form bladders used to trap prey. This species is typically found in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, such as ponds and marshes. The plant produces tiny, white flowers that are often submerged or just above the water surface. Its unique adaptations allow it to thrive in nutrient-poor water by supplementing its diet with captured microscopic organisms.
